Creation

A creation is a region of True Creation in a non-default state, usually consisting of a connected mass of mana-infused anicca forming a Girdle, surrounding a store of mana, anicca, and atman. Being saturated with activated mana by the will of its creator or creators, it is a pocket of temporal existence separated from the a-temporal Great Beyond by its Girdle.

List of Creations

  • Marlien
  • Totum

Lifespan

Because the Girdle itself must consume mana at some rate in order to sustain the temporal existence of the creation, its lifespan may be finite. Typically this lifespan is as long as the creator or creators willed it to be - proportional to the rate of mana consumption by the Girdle, and the quantity of mana initially placed within it.

Manipulation of mana by atman within the creation, whether independently or as a collective, may be enough to alter the fate of the creation to such an extent as to delay its demise. Typically this requires such a quantity of mana as can only be spared by powerful divine atman, or otherwise released by the Soul Destruction of mortal atman, but only the former method might be sufficient to sustain the creation indefinitely.

The eventual collapse of the Girdle due to exhaustion of its mana supplies is sudden and complete.

Further, some creations are made with a fissure that leaks mana into the Great Beyond, drawing the world towards a slow starvation in which the Creation becomes inert long before the Girdle collapses.

Fate

Because all the temporal existence of a creation sits within the a-temporal True Creation, and is shaped for the most part by those interested divine atman named the creators of it, having a view upon the entire temporal painting of the creation in its sculpting, it may be said that there is a certain amount of predestination and fate within it.

This is, however, not absolute: every atman with an interest may have diverted a part of its will towards the sculpting of a creation, whether it entered into it or not, and yet further lack of precision is introduced by the unpredictable manner in which any atman might manipulate the creation once placed into temporal existance - especially those brought in with their own agenda, or against their will.

In fact, many creations seem to be deliberately designed with complex Internal Mechanisms to ensure emergent behaviour, and a lack of specificity or precision in design.
